item.title: 诺瑟姆公司首席执行官表示，需要削减钯金产量以刺激市场
item.description: 南非一家钯金生产商的老板说，除非采矿业进一步削减供应，否则钯金价格不会回升。【原文：Palladium prices won’t recover unless the mining industry cuts supply further, according to the boss of a South African producer.】

item.title: 纽约食糖交付纠纷以德雷福斯撤诉告终
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，一场关于通过纽约交易所销售的食糖交货延迟的纠纷以路易-德莱弗斯公司（Louis Dreyfus Co.）提起的诉讼被驳回而告终。【原文：A dispute over delays to sugar deliveries sold through a New York exchange ended with a case brought by Louis Dreyfus Co. being dismissed, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 挪威基金道德委员会搜索国防控股与加沙的联系
item.description: 挪威1.6万亿美元主权财富基金的道德委员会正在调查哪些公司向以色列出售武器，用于其对加沙哈马斯的战争，并可能建议 "非常有限的 "几家武器制造商撤资。【原文：The ethics council for Norway’s $1.6 trillion sovereign wealth fund is investigating which companies are selling weapons to Israel for use in its war against Hamas in Gaza, and may advise divesting a “very limited” number of arms manufacturers.】

item.title: 医疗保险公司就意外医疗费用发出警告
item.description: 美国医疗保险公司称，由于各州在大流行病发生后剥夺了数百万人的医疗补助福利，他们的利润受到挤压。【原文：US health insurers say their profits are being squeezed because states stripped Medicaid benefits from millions of people after the pandemic.】

item.title: 印度央行行长拉奥称印度考虑允许不良银行购买股权
item.description: 印度储备银行副行长拉杰什瓦-拉奥（M. Rajeshwar Rao）表示，印度储备银行正在考虑允许不良债务的买家也购买受压企业的股权。【原文：The Reserve Bank of India is considering allowing buyers of distressed debt to pick up equity stakes in stressed firms as well, according to Deputy Governor M. Rajeshwar Rao.】

item.title: 美国银行放宽停止向部分枪支制造商贷款的承诺
item.description: 在得克萨斯州和佛罗里达州反 ESG 政客的压力下，美国银行公司正在放宽对枪支和能源行业的贷款限制。【原文：Bank of America Corp. is loosening restrictions on lending to the firearms and energy industries amid pressure from anti-ESG politicians in Texas and Florida.】

item.title: Soho House 拒绝收购要约，称其低估了公司价值
item.description: Soho House & Co.拒绝了一个 "大幅溢价 "的收购要约，这表明这家不盈利的会员制俱乐部对其扭亏为盈的能力充满信心。【原文：Soho House & Co. rejected an acquisition offer at a “substantial premium,” suggesting the unprofitable members-only club is confident in its ability to turn around.】

item.title: 通胀指标符合预期后国债收益率下挫
item.description: 在 4 月份的个人收入和支出数据显示通胀良好之后，国债抹去了小幅跌幅，收益率走低了几个基点。【原文：Treasuries erased modest losses, with yields turning lower by a couple of basis points, after benign inflation readings accompanied April personal income and spending data.】

item.title: 赫斯股东以微弱多数通过雪佛龙收购案
item.description: 赫斯公司股东以 51% 的微弱多数通过了雪佛龙公司以 530 亿美元收购该公司的提议。【原文：Hess Corp. shareholders approved the company’s proposal to be acquired by Chevron Corp. for $53 billion by a razor-thin majority of 51% of shares outstanding.】

item.title: 私人信贷公司 Ninepoint 停止向三只基金支付现金
item.description: 加拿大投资管理公司 Ninepoint Partners LP 暂时停止了旗下三只私人信贷基金的现金分配。【原文：Canadian investment manager Ninepoint Partners LP is temporarily suspending cash distributions in three of its private credit funds.】

item.title: 与 SQM 签订协议后，Codelco 将进军锂市场
item.description: 铜业巨头科德尔科公司（Codelco）与智利国有企业 SQM 公司签署了一项合作协议，后者将获得 SQM 公司宝贵的智利卤水资产的多数股份，科德尔科公司即将成为全球主要的锂业公司。【原文：Copper behemoth Codelco is about to become a major global lithium player after signing a partnership that will give the state-owned company a majority stake in SQM’s prized Chilean brine assets.】

item.title: 六位量化金融先驱走进酒吧，却没人有股票交易技巧
item.description:
聆听数学家、交易员和畅销书作家纳西姆-尼古拉斯-塔勒布谈论不确定性、风险和概率人生。【原文：

Listening in as mathematicians, traders, and bestselling writer Nassim Nicholas Taleb talk about uncertainty, risk and the probabilistic life.

】

item.title: 尼日利亚立法者寻求剥夺中央银行的关键权力
item.description: 尼日利亚立法者希望剥夺中央银行制定利率的最终决定权，转而提议成立一个由财政部长领导的新团队。【原文：Nigerian lawmakers want to strip the central bank of the final decision in setting interest rates, instead proposing a new team to be headed by the minister of finance.】

item.title: 马尔贝克葡萄酒的故乡在阿根廷矿业复兴中与铜业博弈
item.description: 阿根廷门多萨省以马尔贝克（Malbec）葡萄园而闻名，吸引着来自世界各地的游客。该省正在采取行动，促进对铜矿的勘探，由于种种限制和繁文缛节，勘探者长期以来一直避而远之。【原文：Argentina’s Mendoza province, known for Malbec vineyards that draw tourists from across the world, is moving to spur exploration of its copper deposits long shunned by prospectors due to restrictions and red tape.】

item.title: 美国电网如何挤掉核能
item.description:
现代网格的起源。【原文：

The origins of the modern grid.

】

item.title: 欧佩克+将在另一次虚拟会议上延长石油削减计划
item.description:
如果该集团想捍卫价格，就没有增加供应的空间，更不用说推高价格了。【原文：

There’s no room for more supply if the group wants to defend prices, let alone push them higher.

】

item.title: 政府提供新支持后，中国房屋销售下滑势头有所缓解
item.description: 5 月份，中国住宅房地产市场的下滑势头有所减弱，这表明政府近期为重振市场所做的努力已初见成效。【原文：The downturn in China’s residential real estate market weakened in May, suggesting that the government’s recent efforts to revive the market are beginning to take hold.】

item.title: 大投资者要求对冲基金在收取费用前先行打款
item.description: 机构投资者已经厌倦了向对冲基金支付他们认为 "毫无技术含量的回报 "的费用。【原文：Institutional investors have grown tired of paying fees to hedge funds for what they see as “skill-less returns.”】

item.title: 瑞银完成历史性收购，瑞士信贷不复存在
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）完成了对其前竞争对手瑞士信贷（Credit Suisse）的历史性收购，标志着瑞士金融业翻开了新的篇章，这家已倒闭的银行已正式不复存在。【原文：UBS Group AG completed the historic acquisition of its former rival Credit Suisse, marking a new chapter for the Swiss financial sector as the defunct bank has formally ceased to exist.】

item.title: 等待三个月后，罕见的俄罗斯石油货物在加纳卸货
item.description: 一艘在加纳沿海装载俄罗斯原油的油轮在等待三个月后终于卸下了货物。【原文：An oil tanker holding Russian crude oil off the coast of Ghana is finally unloading its cargo after a three-month wait.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。投资者在等待关键的美国通胀指标，交易员在判断特朗普的信念所带来的影响，戴尔公司在人工智能方面未能达到高预期后出现下滑。以下是市场动态。【原文：Good morning. Investors wait for a key US inflation gauge, traders judge the impact of Trump’s conviction and Dell slumps after failing to meet lofty expectations on AI. Here’s what’s moving markets. — David Goodman】

item.title: 美国银行称美国科技股下跌可能是股市下一个痛苦交易
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的策略师表示，如果投资者押注科技巨头将继续推动股市上涨，那么当其他行业开始迎头赶上时，他们可能会遭遇坎坷。【原文：Investors betting that technology behemoths will continue to fuel the rally in equities could be in for a rough ride when other sectors start to catch up, according to strategists at Bank of America Corp.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，阿克曼计划 Pershing Square 最快于 2025 年上市
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》报道，对冲基金经理比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）计划其旗下的潘兴广场（Pershing Square）投资公司最快于明年进行首次公开募股。【原文：Hedge-fund manager Bill Ackman plans an initial public offering of his Pershing Square investment firm as soon as next year, the Wall Street Journal reported.】

item.title: 尼日利亚小组寻求将税收数量削减约 87
item.description: 尼日利亚计划将这个非洲人口最多的国家的税收数量减少 87% 以上，以方便居民纳税，增加财政收入。【原文：Nigeria plans to reduce the number of levies in Africa’s most-populous nation by more than 87% in a bid to make it easier for residents to pay taxes and boost revenue.】

item.title: 日本上月投入 620 亿美元干预日元汇率，创历史新高
item.description: 在过去的一个月里，日本为支撑日元花费了创纪录的 9.8 万亿日元（622 亿美元），超过了 2022 年日元兑美元跌至 34 年低点后日本为保护日元所使用的金额。【原文：Japan spent a record ¥9.8 trillion ($62.2 billion) in the past month to prop up the yen, surpassing the amount it used in 2022 to defend the currency after it fell to a 34-year low against the dollar.】

item.title: 非洲开发银行称非洲难以承受 750 亿美元的利息支出
item.description: 非洲开发银行（African Development Bank）的数据显示，非洲国家今年将花费 750 亿美元用于支付债务利息，而这些钱正是它们在社会支出和公共投资等紧迫问题上所急需的。【原文：African nations will spend $75 billion on debt interest payments this year, money they desperately need for pressing issues such as social spending and public investments, according to the African Development Bank.】

item.title: 中国要求债券承销商检查地方债务风险
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的一份通知，中国市场监管部门本周要求一些金融公司审查任何可能违背政府化解地方债务风险计划的债券承销行为。【原文：A Chinese market watchdog asked some financial firms this week to review any bond underwriting that may have gone against government plans to defuse local debt risks, according to a notice seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 经济学家斯蒂芬-罗奇：美国面临与中国 "永远 "打贸易战的风险
item.description: 经济学家斯蒂芬-罗奇（Stephen Roach）批评美国对华贸易政策是一个 "错误"，有可能造成两国之间无休止的经济冲突。【原文：Economist Stephen Roach criticized US trade policies against China as a “blunder” that risks creating an endless economic conflict between the two nations.】

item.title: 中国誓言进一步调查恒大欺诈案当事人
item.description: 中国市场监管机构誓言继续调查涉及中国恒大集团涉嫌欺诈的 "中介机构"。【原文：China’s market regulator vowed to press ahead with a probe into “intermediary agencies” involved in an alleged fraud by China Evergrande Group.】

item.title: 新加坡指定 ST 物流公司和壳牌为关键实体
item.description: 新加坡将 ST Logistics Pte.和壳牌石油公司（Shell Plc）的本地部门等九家公司定为对经济至关重要的公司，这一分类将加强政府对涉及这些公司的任何收购行动的监督。【原文：Singapore designated nine companies, including ST Logistics Pte. and Shell Plc’s local unit, as critical to the economy, a classification that will heighten government oversight on any takeover moves involving these firms.】
